comments.body: @jdef - can you please take a look if that makes sense now?

Sorry I think I'm missing the whole point of this Resync func. Can someone give me additional context? This implementation is more correct in the sense that it's putting the correct types into internal data structures now. But ADD and UPDATE events should already be queued so this feels somewhat redundant. What am I missing?

Sure.
So basically, so far most of  of reflectors/informers etc. were periodically relisting objects from etcd. However, this doesn't make much sense. However, different controllers rely on the fact that they need to process all objects every X seconds/minutes. So instead of doing relist every such period, we are introducing resync operation, to avoid unnecessary operations on etcd.

So basically this is "SYNC" operation. E.g. in DeltaFifo we have a dedicated event type for it:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/client/cache/delta_fifo.go#L499

I'm not sure if you need it or not in your code.
I'm mostly sure that this change won't break anything since an object's UID isn't supposed to change over time, and all of our indexing is based on that UID
